task.summary:
Add string comparison tool with resource matching logic
This commit introduces functionality to compare strings in input files against keys in a resource file. It includes a UI update with a "String Comparison Tool" interface and backend logic to parse files, perform comparisons, and generate a detailed report with matched and unmatched strings. Error handling and file selection dialogs are also implemented.

Add new WPF project OrdenateResourceStrings to solution
Introduced a new WPF project, OrdenateResourceStrings, with .NET 9.0 and enabled nullable references. Includes basic setup such as App.xaml, MainWindow.xaml, and project configuration for WPF support. Registered the project in the solution file to integrate with the existing build configurations.

Add folder selection and file processing functionality
Introduced UI elements for selecting input and output folders with associated logic for folder browsing. Implemented functionality to process and sort XAML resource string files, ensuring valid paths and error handling for user interaction. Updated window design to accommodate new features.

Refactor resource dictionary sorting logic
Reorganized code to clearly separate header, sorted content, and footer lines when processing resource dictionaries. This improves readability and ensures accurate handling of file sections.

Fix missing ResourceDictionary closing tag during sorting
Ensure the `</ResourceDictionary>` tag is preserved or added if missing when sorting resource strings. This prevents invalid XML output and ensures the generated files remain well-formed.

Ensure closing ResourceDictionary tag is always added
Updated the logic to verify the presence of the closing `</ResourceDictionary>` tag and append it if missing. Minor code formatting changes were also made for readability and consistency.

Refactor resource string sorting logic in MainWindow.cs
Enhanced sorting by separating header, resource strings, and footer for clarity and accuracy. Improved robustness of `ExtractKey` method to handle edge cases with malformed `x:Key` attributes more gracefully. Updated code readability with comments and minor formatting changes.

Add DetectMissingKeys project for XAML key comparison
Introduced a new WPF project, "DetectMissingKeys," to compare XAML keys across files and detect missing or extra keys. The project supports selecting files and folders, processes XAML files to extract keys, and generates a detailed comparison report.

Add tool to detect mismatched resource strings in projects
Introduced a new WPF application, "DetectMissMatchedResourceStrings," to identify inconsistencies in resource key fallback values across files. The tool scans selected directories, generates a detailed mismatch report, and uses a simple UI with folder selection and reporting functionality.

Refactor and enhance XAML resource management tools
Improved code structure with file-scoped namespaces and modern C# syntax. Introduced a detailed user interface for better usability and updated README for clearer documentation. These changes simplify maintenance, improve user experience, and align the tools with contemporary coding standards.

Rename solution file to 'XAML Resource Management Tools'
The solution file name was updated to better reflect its purpose and align with the project's focus on XAML resource management. This change improves clarity and consistency across the repository.

MESSAGE.value:
Add initial WPF project for resource string detection
This commit initializes a WPF project named DetectResourceStrings. It includes functionality to compare resource keys in XAML files with references in other files, generating a report of matches and mismatches. Essential setup files like `.gitignore`, solution, project, and boilerplate code are included.

Add string comparison tool with resource matching logic
This commit introduces functionality to compare strings in input files against keys in a resource file. It includes a UI update with a "String Comparison Tool" interface and backend logic to parse files, perform comparisons, and generate a detailed report with matched and unmatched strings. Error handling and file selection dialogs are also implemented.

Add new WPF project OrdenateResourceStrings to solution
Introduced a new WPF project, OrdenateResourceStrings, with .NET 9.0 and enabled nullable references. Includes basic setup such as App.xaml, MainWindow.xaml, and project configuration for WPF support. Registered the project in the solution file to integrate with the existing build configurations.

Add folder selection and file processing functionality
Introduced UI elements for selecting input and output folders with associated logic for folder browsing. Implemented functionality to process and sort XAML resource string files, ensuring valid paths and error handling for user interaction. Updated window design to accommodate new features.

Refactor resource dictionary sorting logic
Reorganized code to clearly separate header, sorted content, and footer lines when processing resource dictionaries. This improves readability and ensures accurate handling of file sections.

Fix missing ResourceDictionary closing tag during sorting
Ensure the `</ResourceDictionary>` tag is preserved or added if missing when sorting resource strings. This prevents invalid XML output and ensures the generated files remain well-formed.

Ensure closing ResourceDictionary tag is always added
Updated the logic to verify the presence of the closing `</ResourceDictionary>` tag and append it if missing. Minor code formatting changes were also made for readability and consistency.

Refactor resource string sorting logic in MainWindow.cs
Enhanced sorting by separating header, resource strings, and footer for clarity and accuracy. Improved robustness of `ExtractKey` method to handle edge cases with malformed `x:Key` attributes more gracefully. Updated code readability with comments and minor formatting changes.

Add DetectMissingKeys project for XAML key comparison
Introduced a new WPF project, "DetectMissingKeys," to compare XAML keys across files and detect missing or extra keys. The project supports selecting files and folders, processes XAML files to extract keys, and generates a detailed comparison report.

Add tool to detect mismatched resource strings in projects
Introduced a new WPF application, "DetectMissMatchedResourceStrings," to identify inconsistencies in resource key fallback values across files. The tool scans selected directories, generates a detailed mismatch report, and uses a simple UI with folder selection and reporting functionality.

Refactor and enhance XAML resource management tools
Improved code structure with file-scoped namespaces and modern C# syntax. Introduced a detailed user interface for better usability and updated README for clearer documentation. These changes simplify maintenance, improve user experience, and align the tools with contemporary coding standards.

Rename solution file to 'XAML Resource Management Tools'
The solution file name was updated to better reflect its purpose and align with the project's focus on XAML resource management. This change improves clarity and consistency across the repository.
